author: Staff Reporter
text:
As part of Road Safety Week events, a rally was taken out here on Wednesday to create awareness of the importance of two-wheeler riders wearing helmets.

Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis flagged off the rally in the presence of Assistant Superintendent of Police, Tuticorin Town, P. Arun Sakthi Kumar, and Regional Transport Officer K. Anand. Wearing helmets, the participants of the rally assembled near Tuticorin South police station on Palayamkottai Road and rode two-wheelers through WGC Road, Victoria Extension Road, Devarpuram Road and returned to the starting point

Talking to the media, Mr. Kotnis said that 77,000 cases were booked in the district in 2015 against those who did not wear helmets. The rule apart, the riders should realise that wearing helmets provided safety to them, the SP said.

Pamphlets on road safety were given to the public near the traffic signal on Palayamkottai Road. A medical camp would be conducted soon to screen bus drivers on the premises of Regional Transport Office here, the RTO said. On Tuesday (January 19), government employees and students and staff of educational institutions would take an oath to drive safely, he said.
title: Stress on wearing helmets
